original: Colliander, Nils Erland Leopoild Ernst, ingenjör, Göteborg, f. 18/6/11 i Gbg av rådman E. C. o. Conny Berggren. G. 38 m. Ulla Nilson. Barn: Claes f. 39, Göran 42. — Reailex. v. Gbgs latin, språkstud. i Engl. o. Tyskl, motortekn. kurs v. Gbgs tekn. sk., ing:ex. v. Sthlms tekn. inst. 35, arb:-studie- o. arb :led:kurser v. Sv. ind:-förb. Prakt :anst. ^i Sv:e o. Engl. inom mek. verkst:-, kex-, wafers- o. chokladind. 29-38, ing. v. Gbgs Kex-fabr. A-B sed. 36. Led. av &tyr. f. Gbgs Kexfabr. A-B m. fil. Medl. av Frimurarorden, Odd Fellow, Göta
translated: Colliander, Nils Erland Leopold Ernst, engineer, from Gothenburg, born on June 18, 1911 in Gothenburg to councilman E.C. and Conny Berggren. Married in 1938 to Ulla Nilson. Children: Claes, born in 1939, and Göran, born in 1942. Education includes vocational studies in Latin at Gothenburg, language studies in English and German, a motor engineering course at Gothenburg Technical School, and a degree in engineering from Stockholm Technical Institute in 1935. Completed apprenticeships and management courses in mechanical engineering, biscuit and wafer, and chocolate industries from 1929 to 1938. Employed as an engineer at Gothenburg Wafer Factory AB since 1936. Member of the board of directors of Gothenburg Wafer Factory AB with a philosophy degree. Member of the Freemasons, Odd Fellow, and Göta organizations.

education.description: Apprenticeships and management courses completed in mechanical engineering, biscuit and wafer, and chocolate industries

memberOf.name: Board of Directors of Gothenburg Wafer Factory AB
